oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian ceramic vessel with human motif
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian vessel with a human face designed into the neck, containing two eyes, a protruding nose, and a slit mouth. On the opposite side from the face, a small handle extends from the neck. Just below the neck, two areas extend from the body on both sides of the face, which may represent shoulders. Vessel has a wide body, narrow base, and a white slip.
Shows signs of general wear. Body contains pencil markings.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
